actor_awards.notes: A legendary vocal arranger and musical director who defined the 'MGM Sound' of the 1940s. She is best known for her scene-stealing role as Maggie Prescott in 'Funny Face' and as the author of the 'Eloise' children's books. She was also a mentor and lifelong friend to Judy Garland and Liza Minnelli.

filmography.title: Funny Face
filmography.role_description: A dynamic and domineering fashion magazine editor (based on Diana Vreeland) who exhorts women to 'Think Pink!'
filmography.plot: A fashion editor and a photographer choose a shy bookstore clerk as their 'quality woman' and take her to Paris, where she falls for the photographer.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Tell Me That You Love Me, Junie Moon
filmography.role_description: The strict hospital matron and landlady to the three misfit protagonists. (Her final film role)
filmography.plot: Three misfits—a disfigured woman, a paraplegic gay man, and an epileptic—decide to live together to support each other.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Nomination – Palme d'Or (Otto Preminger)

filmography.title: Manhattan Merry-Go-Round
filmography.role_description: She appears as herself, performing with her choir in this musical comedy.
filmography.plot: Gangsters take over a record company and use strong-arm tactics to sign talent.

filmography.title: The Kid from Brooklyn
filmography.role_description: A supporting role in this musical comedy starring Danny Kaye.
filmography.plot: A shy milkman accidentally knocks out a champion boxer and becomes a prizefighter.

filmography.title: Meet Me in St. Louis
filmography.role_description: Responsible for the vocal arrangements, particularly shaping Judy Garland's performances of 'The Trolley Song' and 'Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas'.
filmography.plot: In the year leading up to the 1904 St. Louis World's Fair, the four Smith daughters learn lessons of life and love.

filmography.title: The Harvey Girls
filmography.role_description: Arranged the vocals for the Oscar-winning song 'On the Atchison, Topeka and the Santa Fe'.
filmography.plot: A group of mail-order waitresses head west to open a Harvey House restaurant and bring civilization to a rowdy town.

filmography.title: Ziegfeld Follies
filmography.role_description: Directed the choir and arranged vocals for the elaborate opening number 'Here's to the Girls'.
filmography.plot: The late Florenz Ziegfeld looks down from heaven and imagines a new revue featuring the greatest MGM stars.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Win – Best Musical Comedy

filmography.title: Good News
filmography.role_description: Arranged the energetic vocal numbers for this collegiate musical, including 'The Varsity Drag'.
filmography.plot: A college football hero falls for a studious girl who helps him study so he can play in the big game.

filmography.title: The Pirate
filmography.role_description: Collaborated with Judy Garland and Gene Kelly on the sophisticated musical numbers for this Cole Porter score.
filmography.plot: A girl is engaged to a local rich man but dreams of the legendary pirate Macoco; a traveling actor pretends to be him to win her heart.

filmography.title: Easter Parade
filmography.role_description: Worked on the vocal arrangements for this blockbuster Irving Berlin musical starring Judy Garland and Fred Astaire.
filmography.plot: A nightclub performer hires a naive chorus girl to become his new partner to make his former partner jealous.

filmography.title: Cabin in the Sky
filmography.role_description: Arranged the choral music for this all-Black musical fable.
filmography.plot: A compulsive gambler dies during a fight but is given six months to redeem his soul.

filmography.title: Girl Crazy
filmography.role_description: Arranged the vocals for the Mickey Rooney and Judy Garland musical featuring Gershwin standards.
filmography.plot: A wealthy playboy is sent to a Nevada ranch to keep him out of trouble, where he turns the place into a dude ranch.

filmography.title: Anchors Aweigh
filmography.role_description: Provided vocal arrangements for this hit musical starring Frank Sinatra and Gene Kelly.
filmography.plot: Two sailors on leave in Hollywood help an aspiring singer get an audition at MGM.

filmography.title: Till the Clouds Roll By
filmography.role_description: Arranged the vocals for this star-studded biopic of composer Jerome Kern.
filmography.plot: A musical biography of composer Jerome Kern, featuring performances of his songs by various MGM stars.

filmography.title: The Barkleys of Broadway
filmography.role_description: Arranged the vocals for the reunion film of Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers.
filmography.plot: A musical comedy team threatens to break up when the wife decides she wants to be a serious dramatic actress.

filmography.title: Words and Music
filmography.role_description: Responsible for the vocal arrangements in this biopic of Rodgers and Hart.
filmography.plot: A fictionalized biography of the songwriting partnership of Richard Rodgers and Lorenz Hart.

filmography.title: In the Good Old Summertime
filmography.role_description: Arranged the musical numbers for this remake of 'The Shop Around the Corner' starring Judy Garland.
filmography.plot: Two feuding music shop employees don't realize they are actually romantic pen pals.

filmography.title: A Date with Judy
filmography.role_description: Provided vocal arrangements for this teen musical comedy starring Jane Powell and Elizabeth Taylor.
filmography.plot: A teenager prepares for her high school dance while suspecting her father of infidelity when he takes rumba lessons.

filmography.title: Lady Be Good
filmography.role_description: Arranged vocals for the Oscar-winning song 'The Last Time I Saw Paris'.
filmography.plot: A composer and lyricist couple divorce but continue to work together, realizing they are still in love.

filmography.title: Du Barry Was a Lady
filmography.role_description: Arranged the musical numbers for this Technicolor musical comedy starring Lucille Ball and Red Skelton.
filmography.plot: A coatroom attendant dreams he is King Louis XV of France and that the nightclub singer he loves is Madame Du Barry.

filmography.title: Presenting Lily Mars
filmography.role_description: Worked on the musical sequences for this Judy Garland film about a small-town girl trying to make it on Broadway.
filmography.plot: A stagestruck girl from a small town follows a producer to New York and tries to get a part in his play.

filmography.title: Two Girls and a Sailor
filmography.role_description: Arranged the vocals for this wartime musical starring June Allyson and Van Johnson.
filmography.plot: Two sisters, both singers, fall for the same sailor, but he only has eyes for one of them.

filmography.title: Thousands Cheer
filmography.role_description: Arranged the musical finale for this morale-boosting film featuring a cavalcade of MGM stars.
filmography.plot: An aerialist puts his career on hold to join the army, where he falls for the colonel's daughter.

filmography.title: I Dood It
filmography.role_description: Worked on the musical numbers for this Red Skelton comedy involving a sabotage plot.
filmography.plot: A valet falls in love with a dancing star and they get married to spite her boyfriend, only to face a sabotage plot.

filmography.title: Jubilee
filmography.role_description: Starred in this made-for-TV musical special alongside Patrice Munsel.
filmography.plot: A musical comedy special about a royal family forced to live as commoners.
